Detailed Description

This class defines a configuration, i.e. an oriented point in two dimension.

Since
0.3.1

Definition at line 21 of file configuration.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Config::Config ( )
inline

The default constructor should only be used for array initializations: it correspond to a default point with zero orientation.

See also
default constructor of Point.

Definition at line 43 of file configuration.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

bool Config::hasInFront ( const Point &  point) const
inline

Checks whether a point is in the front half-plane of the current configuration: the vector connecting the current configuration's position to the given point should make an angle between and with the current configuration's orientation.

The vector going from the configuration's position to the point and the vector of same orientation as the configuration should have a positive scalar product.

Parameters
pointa point.
Returns
whether the given point is in the front half-plane of the current configuration.
See also
position, orientation, Point::operator-, Vector::operator*(const Vector&).

Definition at line 236 of file configuration.hpp.

bool Config::isAlignedWith ( const Config &  other) const
inline

Checks whether two configurations are aligned: their orientations should be equal, and be the same as the orientation of the segment connecting their positions.

The configurations are aligned iff they are simultaneously parallel and symmetric.

Returns
whether the current configuration and the given one are aligned.
See also
isParallelTo, isSymmetricTo.

Definition at line 214 of file configuration.hpp.

bool Config::isParallelTo ( const Config &  other) const
inline

Checks whether two configurations are parallel, i.e. whether their orientations are equal (modulo ).

Parameters
otheranother configuration.
Returns
whether the current configuration and the given one have same orientation.
See also
orientation, Object::mod2pi, Object::isZero.

Definition at line 177 of file configuration.hpp.

bool Config::isSymmetricTo ( const Config &  other) const
inline

Checks whether two configurations are symmetric, i.e. whether their orientations are symmetric wrt the line segment connecting their position.

The vector connecting the positions and the vector of average orientation should be collinear: their vectorial product should be zero.

Parameters
otheranother configuration.
Returns
whether the current configuration and the given one are symmetric.
See also
position, orientation, Vector::operator^, Object::isZero.

Definition at line 127 of file configuration.hpp.

Config& Config::uTurn ( )
inline

Turns the current oriented point to its opposite: the position does not change but the orientation is replaced by its opposite ( is added to it).

Returns
the new oriented point, one transformed to its opposite.
